```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

library(sf)
library(tmap)
```


### Read in SF trees data 

```{r }

sf_trees <- read_csv(here::here("data", "sf_trees", "sf_trees.csv"))


```

### Basic wrangling reminders

Refresh some skills for data wrangling and summary statistics using functions in the `dplyr` package. 

Find the top five highest obeservations of trees by legal_status, do some wrangling, make a graph 
```{r}
top_5_status <-  sf_trees %>% 
  count(legal_status) %>%  # can count by multiple variables 
  drop_na(legal_status) %>% 
  rename(tree_count = n) %>% 
  relocate(tree_count) %>%  # cool function for reordering columns
  slice_max(tree_count, n = 5)



```
